item.title: 价值 4 万亿美元的海湾基金和运作这些基金的权力经纪人
item.description: 本周，中东主权财富基金通常平静的世界发生了一系列变化。卡塔尔为其价值 5100 亿美元的基金任命了新的首席执行官，科威特正在更换其 1 万亿美元国家支持投资者的负责人，而阿布扎比投资局正在进行战略调整。【原文：The normally quiet world of Middle Eastern sovereign wealth funds was jolted by a series of changes this week. Qatar named a new chief executive officer for its $510 billion fund, Kuwait is replacing the head of its $1 trillion state-backed investor, while the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority is in the midst of a strategic shift.】

item.title: 前德意志交易所工作人员在内幕交易案中被定罪
item.description: 一名德国证券交易所前雇员因秘密利用法兰克福证券交易所从上市公司获得的非公开信息进行交易而被判处缓刑，并必须支付 16.3 万欧元。【原文：A former Deutsche Boerse AG employee was handed a suspended sentence and must pay €163,000 for secretly trading on non-public information the Frankfurt stock exchange received from listed companies.】

item.title: 鱿鱼游戏 "卷土重来，考验 Netflix 全球营销实力
item.description:
主创人员黄东赫讨论了将于 12 月 26 日首播的第二季乌托邦惊悚片的制作过程

。【原文：

Creator Hwang Dong-hyuk discusses making season two of the dystopian thriller, which debuts Dec. 26

】

item.title: 特朗普将 "破坏球 "瞄准气候政策
item.description:
当选总统表示，他将退出巴黎气候协定，并提高石油和天然气产量。【原文：

The president-elect has said he’ll exit the Paris climate accord and ramp up oil and gas production.

】

item.title: 纽约市养老基金决定加入气候金融集团
item.description: 纽约市的一家养老基金正在加入一个气候金融集团，加倍努力应对全球变暖带来的投资风险。【原文：One of New York City’s pension funds is joining a climate-finance group as it double downs on efforts to address investment risks from global warming.】

item.title: Palantir 股价不敌越来越多持怀疑态度的分析师
item.description: Palantir Technologies Inc. 的股价持续走高，令怀疑论者感到困惑，即使华尔街的一些人对其天价估值和公司收入增长的可持续性提出质疑。【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc. is confounding skeptics, with the stock continuing to push higher even as some on Wall Street question its sky-high valuation and the sustainability of the company’s revenue growth.】

item.title: 法国在预测失误后求助经济学家改进预测
item.description: 上届政府的失误破坏了法国政府控制赤字的努力，因此法国政府正在寻求外部经济学家的帮助，以改进财政预测。【原文：The French government is enlisting the help of external economists to improve fiscal forecasting after errors during the previous administration undermined its efforts to rein in the deficit.】

item.title: 欧洲股市落后于美国股市的幅度为 1995 年以来最大
item.description: 欧洲股市落后于美国股市的幅度是近 30 年来最大的；随着唐纳德-特朗普的当选推动全球对美国资产的偏好，这一趋势很可能会进一步恶化。【原文：Europe’s stock market is lagging behind the US by the most in nearly 30 years — a trend that’s likely to worsen as the election of Donald Trump drives a global preference for US assets.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦银行从法院获得对政府征税的救济
item.description: 据巴基斯坦银行协会称，巴基斯坦约有十几家银行已从伊斯兰堡高等法院获得临时救济，如果向私营部门的借款低于目标，政府将对贷款人征税。【原文：About a dozen banks in Pakistan have secured a temporary relief from the Islamabad High Court against a government tax on the lenders if their borrowing to the private sector was lower than the target, according to Pakistan Banks’ Association.】

item.title: 墨西哥银行可能在第三次会议上削减核心通胀：日间指南
item.description: 由于核心通胀率已回到目标区间，且拉美第二大经济体的增长正在放缓，墨西哥可能将于周四连续第三次降息。【原文：Mexico will likely deliver a third straight interest rate cut Thursday as core inflation is back to the target range and growth in Latin America’s second-biggest economy is slowing.】

item.title: 瑞典央行警告放宽对借款人的要求可能会增加风险
item.description: 瑞典央行警告说，放松对抵押贷款分期付款的要求可能会导致稳定性风险增加，并对一项旨在使首次购房者更容易进入住房市场的建议进行了反击。【原文：Sweden’s Riksbank cautioned that loosening requirements on mortgage amortization could lead to increased stability risks, pushing back against a proposal intended to make it easier for first-time buyers to enter the housing market.】

item.title: 经济学家称特朗普对英国征收的关税是 "可控的
item.description: 根据彭博经济公司（Bloomberg Economics）的分析，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对所有出口到美国的商品普遍征收高达 20% 的关税，这对英国来说是 "不受欢迎但可控的"。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump’s threat to slap a universal tariff of up to 20% on all goods exported to the US would be “unwelcome but manageable” for the UK, according to analysis from Bloomberg Economics.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯称通胀数据方向正确
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，欧元区的消费价格数据给政策制定者带来了一些鼓舞。【原文：Euro-area consumer-price numbers are offering some encouragement for policymakers, according to European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos.】

item.title: 资金流入增加，肯尼亚外汇储备创三年新高
item.description: 随着资本加速流入这个东非国家，肯尼亚的外汇储备升至三年来的最高水平，这有助于在其他新兴市场出现抛售的情况下保持其货币稳定。【原文：Kenya’s foreign-exchange reserves rose to their highest level in three years as capital flows into the East African nation accelerated, helping to keep its currency stable amid a sell-off elsewhere in emerging markets.】

item.title: 中国经济释放积极信号，京东收入增长加快
item.description: JD.com Inc.的季度收入增长了5.1%，这表明随着中国政府努力振兴经济，中国消费者又开始谨慎消费了。【原文：JD.com Inc.’s quarterly revenue rose 5.1%, suggesting Chinese consumers are cautiously spending again as Beijing tries to revitalize the economy.】

item.title: 印度 10 月份贸易赤字扩大幅度超出预期
item.description: 由于印度教节日期间进口攀升，印度 10 月份的贸易赤字大幅扩大，尽管出口实现了强劲增长。【原文：India’s trade deficit widened significantly in October as imports climbed during the Hindu festival season, even though exports posted a robust growth.】

item.description:
前副主席谈下一步工作。【原文：

item.description: 上周，美联储选择将利率下调 25 个基点，这也是市场的预期。但从现在开始，情况会变得更加不确定。今年以来，通胀一直在走软，但有一种感觉是，这种趋势可能会发生转变，尤其是特朗普政府将在新年后上台。所有这些都提出了一个问题：美联储下一步会怎么做？与此同时，特朗普【原文：Last week the Federal Reserve opted to cut interest rates by 25 basis points, which was what the market expected it to do. All of this raises the question of what the Fed does next, and how it’s approaching near-term data versus the longer-term outlook for the economy. At the same time, Trum】

item.title: 国际能源机构称明年全球石油市场将面临百万桶供应缺口
item.description: 国际能源机构称，由于中国需求持续低迷，全球石油市场明年将面临每天超过100万桶的过剩，这将缓冲中东及其他地区的动荡对石油价格的影响。【原文：Global oil markets face a surplus of more than 1 million barrels a day next year as Chinese demand continues to falter, cushioning prices against turmoil in the Middle East and beyond, the International Energy Agency said.】

item.title: Boohoo融资3900万英镑，敦促投资者避开迈克-阿什利
item.description: Boohoo Group Plc 筹集了 3930 万英镑（4980 万美元）资金，试图帮助这家陷入困境的企业扭亏为盈，同时敦促投资者拒绝亿万富翁迈克-阿什利（Mike Ashley）进入董事会的要求。【原文：Boohoo Group Plc raised £39.3 million ($49.8 million) in an attempt to help turn around the struggling business, while urging investors to reject billionaire Mike Ashley’s demand to be installed to the board.】

item.title: 银行将为 Grifols 提出约 110 亿欧元的收购债务协议
item.description: 各家银行正准备向布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）提交约 110 亿欧元（116 亿美元）一揽子债务的最终报价，以支持西班牙制药商 Grifols SA 的私有化。【原文：Banks are getting ready to submit final offers to Brookfield Asset Management for a debt package of about €11 billion ($11.6 billion) to back the take-private of Spanish pharmaceutical producer Grifols SA.】

item.title: 宏观数据公布前欧洲股市走高；西门子上涨
item.description: 欧洲股市周四小幅走高，投资者在等待该地区第三季度的国内生产总值数据，西门子公司和ASML NV等大型公司股票的上涨提振了欧洲股市。【原文：European stocks were slightly higher on Thursday, as investors awaited the region’s third-quarter GDP data, with gains for large cap stocks including Siemens AG and ASML NV boosting the gauge.】

item.title: 多方选择首席执行官称 Canal+ 协议将帮助其对抗 Netflix
item.description: 多选择首席执行官卡尔沃-马维拉（Calvo Mawela）正准备与美国流媒体巨头一较高下，这家非洲电视公司正努力使其与维旺迪公司（Vivendi SE）旗下 Canal+ 公司价值约 30 亿美元的交易获得监管机构的批准。【原文：MultiChoice Chief Executive Officer Calvo Mawela is preparing to take on US streaming giants as the African TV company works to get its approximately $3 billion deal with Vivendi SE’s Canal+ over the line with regulators.】

item.title: 阿提哈德航空公司将投入多达 10 亿美元进行喷气机改装，但仍有延误
item.description: 阿提哈德航空计划斥资多达 10 亿美元对宽体飞机进行大修，因为这家海湾航空公司希望在飞机制造商延迟生产的情况下更新其机队。【原文：Etihad plans to spend as much as $1 billion to overhaul widebody aircraft as the Gulf carrier looks to refresh its fleet amid delays from planemakers.】

item.title: 印度央行行长达斯称印度经济能够抵御全球风险
item.description: 印度央行行长表示，即使全球经济增长面临从地缘政治紧张局势到气候变化等不断加速的风险，印度经济仍 "一帆风顺"。【原文：The Indian economy is “sailing through smoothly,” even as global growth faces accelerating risks ranging from geopolitical tensions to climate change, according to the country’s central bank governor.】

item.title: 中国茶壶选择非洲原油而非伊朗和俄罗斯原油
item.description: 一家中国民营炼油厂购买了一批西非原油，这在中国是罕见的，引起了贸易商的兴趣，因为中国较小的独立加工商通常倾向于从伊朗和俄罗斯进口敏感的、受美国制裁的原油。【原文：A privately owned Chinese refiner bought a cargo of West African crude in a rare purchase that’s piqued traders’ interest given smaller, independent processors in China have typically tended to favor imports of sensitive, US-sanctioned grades from Iran and Russia.】

item.title: 卡莱尔支持的 Apex 公司与人工智能公司合作，为全球超级富豪服务
item.description: 一家由凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：A financial-services firm backed by Carlyle Group Inc. is teaming up with a UK startup that uses artificial intelligence to help the world’s rich manage their investments, highlighting how machine learning is shaping the private-wealth sector.】

item.title: 阿布扎比顶级财富基金增加私募股权投资配置
item.description: 阿布扎比投资局管理着约 1 万亿美元的资产，它计划在私募股权领域进行更多投资，这凸显了其作为具有全球影响力的交易商的影响力。【原文：The Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, which manages around $1 trillion in assets, plans more investments in the private equity sector, underlining its clout as a globally influential dealmaker.】

item.title: 散户投资者在美国大选周抛售日本股票
item.description: 上周，卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在美国总统大选中的激烈角逐令投资者惶恐不安，散户交易员抛售的日本股票数量创下 3 月份以来的新高。【原文：Retail traders offloaded the most Japanese stocks since March last week, when the tight race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump in the US presidential election kept investors on edge.】

item.title: 苹果公司因数据存储指控面临英国集体诉讼
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc）面临英国一个消费者组织的诉讼，指控其在数据存储方面的垄断违反了竞争法，这起新的集体诉讼最终可能使这家科技巨头损失数十亿美元。【原文：Apple Inc faces a lawsuit from a UK consumer group over allegations its monopoly on data storage breaches competition law, in a fresh class action that could ultimately cost the tech giant billions.】
